properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.all-or-none
properties.description: Composite API option to indicate to rollback all records if any are not successful.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.apex-method
properties.description: APEX method name

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.apex-query-params
properties.description: Query params for APEX method

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.apex-url
properties.description: APEX method URL

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.api-version
properties.description: Salesforce API version.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.authentication-type
properties.description: Explicit authentication method to be used, one of USERNAME_PASSWORD, REFRESH_TOKEN or JWT. Salesforce component can auto-determine the authentication method to use from the properties set, set this property to eliminate any ambiguity.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.backoff-increment
properties.description: Backoff interval increment for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.batch-id
properties.description: Bulk API Batch ID

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.client-id
properties.description: OAuth Consumer Key of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup. Typically a connected app needs to be configured but one can be provided by installing a package.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.client-secret
properties.description: OAuth Consumer Secret of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.composite-method
properties.description: Composite (raw) method.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.config
properties.description: Global endpoint configuration - use to set values that are common to all endpoints. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.salesforce.SalesforceEndpointConfig type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.content-type
properties.description: Bulk API content type, one of XML, CSV, ZIP_XML, ZIP_CSV

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.default-replay-id
properties.description: Default replayId setting if no value is found in initialReplayIdMap

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the salesforce component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.fall-back-replay-id
properties.description: ReplayId to fall back to after an Invalid Replay Id response

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.format
properties.description: Payload format to use for Salesforce API calls, either JSON or XML, defaults to JSON. As of Camel 3.12, this option only applies to the Raw operation.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-client
properties.description: Custom Jetty Http Client to use to connect to Salesforce. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.salesforce.SalesforceHttpClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-client-connection-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout used by the HttpClient when connecting to the Salesforce server.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-client-idle-timeout
properties.description: Timeout used by the HttpClient when waiting for response from the Salesforce server.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-client-properties
properties.description: Used to set any properties that can be configured on the underlying HTTP client. Have a look at properties of SalesforceHttpClient and the Jetty HttpClient for all available options.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-max-content-length
properties.description: Max content length of an HTTP response.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-auth-uri
properties.description: Used in authentication against the HTTP proxy server, needs to match the URI of the proxy server in order for the httpProxyUsername and httpProxyPassword to be used for authentication.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-excluded-addresses
properties.description: A list of addresses for which HTTP proxy server should not be used.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-host
properties.description: Hostname of the HTTP proxy server to use.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-included-addresses
properties.description: A list of addresses for which HTTP proxy server should be used.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-password
properties.description: Password to use to authenticate against the HTTP proxy server.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-port
properties.description: Port number of the HTTP proxy server to use.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-realm
properties.description: Realm of the proxy server, used in preemptive Basic/Digest authentication methods against the HTTP proxy server.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-secure
properties.description: If set to false disables the use of TLS when accessing the HTTP proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-socks4
properties.description: If set to true the configures the HTTP proxy to use as a SOCKS4 proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-use-digest-auth
properties.description: If set to true Digest authentication will be used when authenticating to the HTTP proxy, otherwise Basic authorization method will be used

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-proxy-username
properties.description: Username to use to authenticate against the HTTP proxy server.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-request-buffer-size
properties.description: HTTP request buffer size. May need to be increased for large SOQL queries.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.http-request-timeout
properties.description: Timeout value for HTTP requests.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.include-details
properties.description: Include details in Salesforce1 Analytics report, defaults to false.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.initial-replay-id-map
properties.description: Replay IDs to start from per channel name.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.instance-id
properties.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report execution instance ID

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.instance-url
properties.description: URL of the Salesforce instance used after authentication, by default received from Salesforce on successful authentication

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.job-id
properties.description: Bulk API Job ID

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.jwt-audience
properties.description: Value to use for the Audience claim (aud) when using OAuth JWT flow. If not set, the login URL will be used, which is appropriate in most cases.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.keystore
properties.description: KeyStore parameters to use in OAuth JWT flow. The KeyStore should contain only one entry with private key and certificate. Salesforce does not verify the certificate chain, so this can easily be a selfsigned certificate. Make sure that you upload the certificate to the corresponding connected app. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.KeyStoreParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.lazy-login
properties.description: If set to true prevents the component from authenticating to Salesforce with the start of the component. You would generally set this to the (default) false and authenticate early and be immediately aware of any authentication issues.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.limit
properties.description: Limit on number of returned records. Applicable to some of the API, check the Salesforce documentation.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.locator
properties.description: Locator provided by salesforce Bulk 2.0 API for use in getting results for a Query job.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.login-config
properties.description: All authentication configuration in one nested bean, all properties set there can be set directly on the component as well. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.salesforce.SalesforceLoginConfig type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.login-url
properties.description: URL of the Salesforce instance used for authentication, by default set to https://login.salesforce.com

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.long-polling-transport-properties
properties.description: Used to set any properties that can be configured on the LongPollingTransport used by the BayeuxClient (CometD) used by the streaming api

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.max-backoff
properties.description: Maximum backoff interval for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.max-records
properties.description: The maximum number of records to retrieve per set of results for a Bulk 2.0 Query. The request is still subject to the size limits. If you are working with a very large number of query results, you may experience a timeout before receiving all the data from Salesforce. To prevent a timeout, specify the maximum number of records your client is expecting to receive in the maxRecords parameter. This splits the results into smaller sets with this value as the maximum size.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.not-found-behaviour
properties.description: Sets the behaviour of 404 not found status received from Salesforce API. Should the body be set to NULL NotFoundBehaviour#NULL or should a exception be signaled on the exchange NotFoundBehaviour#EXCEPTION - the default.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-fields
properties.description: Notify for fields, options are ALL, REFERENCED, SELECT, WHERE

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-operation-create
properties.description: Notify for create operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-operation-delete
properties.description: Notify for delete operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-operation-undelete
properties.description: Notify for un-delete operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-operation-update
properties.description: Notify for update operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.notify-for-operations
properties.description: Notify for operations, options are ALL, CREATE, EXTENDED, UPDATE (API version < 29.0)

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.object-mapper
properties.description: Custom Jackson ObjectMapper to use when serializing/deserializing Salesforce objects. The option is a com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.packages
properties.description: In what packages are the generated DTO classes. Typically the classes would be generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin. Set it if using the generated DTOs to gain the benefit of using short SObject names in parameters/header values. Multiple packages can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.password
properties.description: Password used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow, but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows. Make sure that you append security token to the end of the password if using one.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.pk-chunking
properties.description: Use PK Chunking. Only for use in original Bulk API. Bulk 2.0 API performs PK chunking automatically, if necessary.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.pk-chunking-chunk-size
properties.description: Chunk size for use with PK Chunking. If unspecified, salesforce default is 100,000. Maximum size is 250,000.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.pk-chunking-parent
properties.description: Specifies the parent object when you're enabling PK chunking for queries on sharing objects. The chunks are based on the parent object's records rather than the sharing object's records. For example, when querying on AccountShare, specify Account as the parent object. PK chunking is supported for sharing objects as long as the parent object is supported.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.pk-chunking-start-row
properties.description: Specifies the 15-character or 18-character record ID to be used as the lower boundary for the first chunk. Use this parameter to specify a starting ID when restarting a job that failed between batches.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.query-locator
properties.description: Query Locator provided by salesforce for use when a query results in more records than can be retrieved in a single call. Use this value in a subsequent call to retrieve additional records.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.raw-http-headers
properties.description: Comma separated list of message headers to include as HTTP parameters for Raw operation.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.raw-method
properties.description: HTTP method to use for the Raw operation

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.raw-path
properties.description: The portion of the endpoint URL after the domain name. E.g., '/services/data/v52.0/sobjects/Account/'

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.raw-payload
properties.description: Use raw payload String for request and response (either JSON or XML depending on format), instead of DTOs, false by default

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.raw-query-parameters
properties.description: Comma separated list of message headers to include as query parameters for Raw operation. Do not url-encode values as this will be done automatically.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.refresh-token
properties.description: Refresh token already obtained in the refresh token OAuth flow. One needs to setup a web application and configure a callback URL to receive the refresh token, or configure using the builtin callback at https://login.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success or https://test.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success and then retrive the refresh_token from the URL at the end of the flow. Note that in development organizations Salesforce allows hosting the callback web application at localhost.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.report-id
properties.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report Id

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.report-metadata
properties.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report metadata for filtering. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.salesforce.api.dto.analytics.reports.ReportMetadata type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.result-id
properties.description: Bulk API Result ID

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-blob-field-name
properties.description: SObject blob field name

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-class
properties.description: Fully qualified SObject class name, usually generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-fields
properties.description: SObject fields to retrieve

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-id
properties.description: SObject ID if required by API

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-id-name
properties.description: SObject external ID field name

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-id-value
properties.description: SObject external ID field value

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-name
properties.description: SObject name if required or supported by API

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-query
properties.description: Salesforce SOQL query string

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.s-object-search
properties.description: Salesforce SOSL search string

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: SSL parameters to use, see SSLContextParameters class for all available options. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.stream-query-result
properties.description: If true, streams SOQL query result and transparently handles subsequent requests if there are multiple pages. Otherwise, results are returned one page at a time.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.update-topic
properties.description: Whether to update an existing Push Topic when using the Streaming API, defaults to false

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.user-name
properties.description: Username used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow, but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.worker-pool-max-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the thread pool used to handle HTTP responses.

properties.name: camel.component.salesforce.worker-pool-size
properties.description: Size of the thread pool used to handle HTTP responses.
